page.title: 16SALT HILL PARK, SLOUGH
page.content: Salt Hill Park was made on land donated to Slough by James Elliman, one of our first industrialists, in 1906. It was then on the edge of Slough! All sorts of people use the park - children play after school and tackle the assault course while mothers take small children during the quieter daytimes. People walk their dogs, go jogging or play team games. Organised sports include football, cricket, tennis and bowls and there is a lot of open space and planted park areas. Most people enjoy the park but some felt that the trains on one side and the Bath Road on the other spoil it. One or two uncared for areas with nettles and rubbish don't look very nice. It would be better to have mats under the swings and slides and a first aid post.
